dataset.title: Grasshopper cage data: Vegetation Phenology and Grasshopper Competition

abstract.para:
Vegetation was sampled at the termination of the experiment on June 25, 1989. Grasshopper densities outside the cages were sampled on May 23 and 24, 1989. After the first experiment, cages were set up on new plots 3m from the edge of the macroplot to avoid using vegetation disturbed by counting. On July 25, adult grasshoppers of two different species (Melanoplus femur-rubrum (FR) and Melanoplus bivattatus (BV)) were stocked according to the above treatments (randomly reassigned) in the following densities: FR by itself, 6/cage; BV by itself, 4/cage; FR and BV together, 4 FR and 3 BV /cage. Vegetation was sampled at the termination of the experiment on August 31, 1989.
In late May of 1990, grasshoppers were stocked in the following numbers in both fertilized and unfertilized plots: no grasshoppers (empty cages), AC by itself (5/cage), PA by itself (4/cage), and both species together (3 of each). With 8 replicates of each fertilizer x grasshopper combination, a total of 64 cages were used. Vegetation was sampled at the end of the experiment as in 1989.
In late July of 1990, two new grasshopper species were used in addition to Melanoplus femur-rubrum (MF): Phoetaliotes nebrascensis (PN) and Spharagemon collare (SC). Grasshoppers were stocked in the following numbers: no grasshoppers (empty cages), MF by itself (6/cage), PN by itself (10/cage), SC by itself (6/cage), MF + PN (3 MF and 5 PN per cage), MF + SC (3 of each per cage), SC + PN (3 SC + 5 PN per cage), and all three species together (2 MF, 2 SC, and 3 PN per cage). Vegetation was sampled at the end of the experiment as in 1989. At the end of the early and late 1990 experiments, a single soil sample was taken from each cage plot and analyzed for soil solution ammonium and nitrate with 0.02M KCl. For a list of treatments, see the treatment layouts in file trmte60.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The Cedar Creek Ecosystem Science Reserve is located in Anoka and Isanti counties, approximately 30 miles north of Saint Paul, MN. CCNHA lies at the boundary between prairie and forest. It is a mosaic of uplands dominated by oak savanna, prairie, hardwood forest, pine forests,and abandoned agricultural fields and of lowlands comprised of ash and cedar swamps, acid bogs, marshes, and sedge meadows. Large tracts of the pre-agricultural ecosystems of the region are preserved within its boundaries, as is a successional chronosequence of more than 80 old fields of known history.

address.deliveryPoint: Ecology Evolution and Behaviour Dept. University Of Minnesota

Grasshopper Treatment: 1 = one grasshopper species by itself 2 = a 2nd grasshopper species by itself 3 = both grasshopper species combined 4 = no grasshoppers

48 10 G 50 1 16 4 Late
Fertilizer is mixed and spread by hand twice a year, once in early May and once in late June. Each plot gets the fertilizer mixture specified by its fertilizer treatment code.
Forty eight windowscreen cages (40cm x 40cm at the base and 122cm tall) were placed over existing vegetation in the macroplots in Field B ( E004).
On May 5, 1995, a wildfire burned all the plots in experiment 60 in field B.

Grasshoppers are sampled. Grasshopper densities are sampled in a 10m x 10m portion of the macroplot adjacent to the grasshopper cages. The density of each grasshopper species compared with that in the cages was the average over three macroplots within a fertilizer treatment. For a list of species and their taxon codes, see file ghoppers.lst.

In 1989, at the termination of the experiment, grasshopper densities were sampled in a 10m x 10m portion of the macroplot adjacent to the grasshopper cages. The density of each grasshopper species compared with that in the cages was the average over three macroplots within a fertilizer treatment. Vegetation was sampled after cages were pulled up within the 40cm x 40cm area contained by the cage. All plants within the 40cm x 40cm area were clipped. Plants were sorted to species, dried at 45 degrees C and weighed. Vegetation was sampled in 1990 in the same way as in 1989.
